intro: Amischotolype tenuis, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshade plants, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
